Being a Hand-Book for Cobblers\

16. Updates"

"INTRODUCTORY NOTES\
\
Man is the upright biped; and, being separated from the common beasts by his gait, his limbs are specialized. The hands are for grasping and touching; the feet are for locomotion. To better preserve the tissues of the feet for this purpose, people of ancient times wrapped them in simple fragments of leather. In our more sophisticated time, such makeshift footwear has given way to warmer, more durable and more comfortable forms. As cobblers, we are among the most sought-after craftspeople within the Castle. Our training, skill and equipment allows us to alter and customize items of footwear, including shoes and boots of all kinds.\
\
Not all clothing items will succumb to the tools of a cobbler. Shirts, pants, dresses, gowns and the like require the more general skills of a tailor. Gloves and handwear are the province of a glover, while hats and headwear are the speciality of the hatter. An experienced dyer is required to change the color of an item; and the application of custom symbols requires the services of an embroiderer. Cobblers are encouraged to consider learning one or more of these skills as well, to widen their abilities and popularity.\
\
Cobblers must also understand and obey the sumptuary restrictions on garments laid down in Her Majesty's Capitulary."

"MATERIAL\
\
Cobblers practice their noble artistry upon two of the most fundamental qualities of footwear, MATERIAL and FIT.\
\
The material of a footwear item defines its texture and feel, but it also denotes the skill of the maker and taste of the wearer. Over thirty different materials are available in Castle Marrach, some of great rarity, or difficult to work. Novices work in common materials such as burlap or linen, while more experienced artisans have access to more exotic fabrics including silk, lizardskin or even spun glass!"

"FIT\
\
FIT describes the quality of the relationship between a footwear item and its wearer. Novices must work hard to achieve even a crude or awkward fit; but after patient training, the serious student will be able to attain more desireable appearances, including flattering, tasteful and provocative fits."

"MEASURES OF PROFICIENCY\
\
Ten levels of craft proficiency are recognized among cobblers:\
\
1. Novice\
2. Junior Apprentice\
3. Senior Apprentice\
4. Fellowcraft\
5. Journeyman\
6. Artisan\
7. Senior Artisan\
8. Master\
9. Master Adept\
10. Grand Master\
\
A Novice cobbler possesses very limited ability, and is able to attempt only a few rudimentary alterations. As skill increases, however, many more possibilities become available. A seasoned Master may command dozens of alteration options.\
\
The remainder of this hand-book describes the alteration options available to cobblers at each level of proficiency."

"NOVICE\
\
Novices are the least experienced class of cobblers. Their alteration skills are admittedly rather limited and uninspiring.\
\
They work in: none, burlap, homespun, or linen.\
\
The unpopular footwear produced by Novices attempts at alteration may have a fit of: none, crude, awkward, or tasteless."

"JUNIOR APPRENTICE\
\
Junior Apprentices can manage a bit more than Novices, but their additional skills can hardly be called impressive.\
\
They work in canvas, cotton, and gauze.\
\
Junior Apprentices produce footwear whose fit can be described as careless, indifferent, or hurried."

"SENIOR APPRENTICE\
\
Senior Apprentices have attained sufficient skill to conduct a handful of modest but useful alterations.\
\
They know the art of working in hemp, muslin, or flannel\
\
The fit of shoes produced by these cobblers will be adequate, loose, or tight."

"FELLOWCRAFT\
\
Fellowcraft Cobblers have spent many hours learning their trade, thereby earning the right to apply a personal mark of excellence onto items which they produce.\
\
They work in leather, lawn, and brocade.\
\
Having mastered the art of comfortable fit, these cobblers can move on to fits of trim, tasteful, or conservative."

"JOURNEYMAN\
\
Journeymen possess the confidence to work with footwear options of significant appeal.\
\
They might employ suede, velveteen, or fur in their creations.\
\
Their footwear might be attractive, modest, or revealing."

"ARTISAN\
\
Artisans have proven themselves capable of the fine control needed to handle some of the more challenging materials and styles.\
\
Their skill includes working in calfskin, satin, and lace.\
\
These cobblers produce classical, provocative, or flattering footwear."

"SENIOR ARTISAN\
\
Senior Artisans are sought by those desiring rare materials and fine cuts for their footwear. They often serve as assistants to Master cobblers.\
\
The tasteful fabrics of serge, damask, and velour are employed by them.\
\
The results of their efforts are elegant, cunning, or stylish."

"MASTER\
\
Masters are the virtuosi of the cobblers' art. Their long career of study and craftsmanship has earned them the ability to work with materials and styles of the most rarified quality. They can also alter the material and fit of footwear items that have already been altered.\
\
The exotic materials they have mastered are lambskin, lizardskin, and silverweave.\
\
Their creations are exquisite, graceful, or beautiful."

"MASTER ADEPT\
\
Master Adepts are recognized as being usually the preeminent artisans of the cobbling craft within the Castle, after countless seasons of research and experience.\
\
The luxurious materials they command the skill to employ include silk, velvet, and goldweave.\
\
Their shoes are perfect, immaculate, or sublime."

"GRAND MASTER\
\
The rank of Grand Master is rarely seen in the Castle; when present, these experts work almost exclusively for the Queen and the upper levels of Her court.\
\
The fantastic materials of iridescent, diaphanous, and glassweave are employed exclusively by them; the fit of their creations is divine."

"UPDATES\
\
As fashions change, and as cobblers discover new materials and styles, alteration choices will change within the Castle. The text of this book will mysteriously update itself as new choices become available. More senior cobblers will inform you if and when updates occur.\
\
Please bring typographical errors or other textual problems found in this volume to the attention of the staff."
